thread.title: Oscars: Jimmy Kimmel mocks Matt Damon
thread.title_full: Oscars: Jimmy Kimmel mocks Matt Damon - Business Insider

author: Kirsten Acuna
title: Oscars: Jimmy Kimmel mocks Matt Damon
text:
ABC
The INSIDER Summary
• Matt Damon and Jimmy Kimmel have had an onscreen "feud" for over the past decade.
• Kimmel used his Oscar monologue to "bury the hatchet" with his frenemy.
• Instead, he called Damon out for making a box-office bomb, "The Great Wall."
We knew this was inevitable.
Jimmy Kimmel referenced his ongoing feud with Matt Damon in his opening monologue for the 89th annual Academy Awards.
Kimmel and Damon have had a love-hate relationship for over the past decade. The running "feud" between the two stars started on Kimmel's late-night show. Each night, Kimmel apologizes to Damon for running out of time for the "Bourne Identity" star. Finally, it led to Damon making a viral video with Kimmel's ex-girlfriend Sarah Silverman .
From there, the two have played stunts on each other for years and have even attempted "couple's counseling."
Sunday evening, during Kimmel's monologue, the late-show host called out his frenemy onstage to seemingly make peace while discussing how divided the country is right now.
"I'm not the man to unite this country, but it can be done," said Kimmel. "If every person watching this show, I don't want to get too serious, but there are millions and millions of people watching right now, and if every one of you took a minute to reach out to one person you disagree with, someone you like and have a positive, considerate conversation, not as liberals or conservatives, as Americans, if we would all do that we could make America great again. We really could. It starts with us."
"Tonight, in the spirit of healing and bringing people together, I would like to bury the hatchet with someone I've had issues with," he continued as the camera panned over to Damon in the audience.
ABC
"I've known Matt for a long time now. I've known Matt so long [that] when I first met Matt I was the fat one," Kimmel said. "And we've had problems. He's a selfish person. Those of you who've work with him know this. But Matt did something very unselfish and I want to commend him for it. For real."
Kimmel recalled how Damon could have starred in Oscar-nominated "Manchester by the Sea," which is nominated for six Academy Awards, including best picture and best actor.
"He could have taken that lead actor part for himself, but he didn't," said Kimmel. "He gave that role to Casey Affleck, his childhood friend. He handed what turned out to be a caliber role over to his friend and made a Chinese ponytail movie instead."
Damon was quick to point out that Affleck had a ponytail of his own. ABC
That movie, of course, is "The Great Wall," which recently bombed at the box office in the states. The movie cost a reported $150 million to make . Domestically, the film has grossed $34 million. The film is faring better overseas where it has grossed another $94 million.
"Smooth move, dumba--," said Kimmel.
Ahead of the Oscars Sunday evening, Matt Damon appeared on "Ellen " where he told her he hoped Kimmel screwed up during the show.
"I'm hoping that he messes up," said Damon. "I'm going to be there a few rows deep hoping that he messes up. I may even throw things at him."
